text:
Agricultural and Veterinary Chemicals (Tasmania) Regulations 2014

I, the Lieutenant-Governor in and over the State of Tasmania and its Dependencies in the Commonwealth of Australia, acting with the advice of the Executive Council, make the following regulations under the Agricultural and Veterinary Chemicals (Tasmania) Act 1994 .

27 October 2014

A. M. BLOW

Lieutenant-Governor

By His Excellency's Command,

JEREMY ROCKLIFF

Minister for Primary Industries and Water

1. Short title
    These regulations may be cited as the Agricultural and Veterinary Chemicals (Tasmania) Regulations 2014 .

2. Commencement
    These regulations take effect on 21 December 2014.

3. Eligible law
    The Agricultural and Veterinary Chemicals (Control of Use) Act 1995 is declared to be an eligible law for the purposes of the definition of permit in section 109 of the Agvet Code of Tasmania.

4. Laws which have effect despite Code
    Under section 36(2)(a) of the Agricultural and Veterinary Chemicals (Tasmania) Act 1994 , the Poisons Act 1971 has effect despite the Agvet Code of Tasmania.

Displayed and numbered in accordance with the Rules Publication Act 1953.

Notified in the Gazette on 5 November 2014

These regulations are administered in the Department of Primary Industries, Parks, Water and Environment.
